Column Comment.0: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.1: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.2: HEADER IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the header.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: DESCRIPTION: Description of the header word and its contents in this case.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: HEADER FORMAT: the format used for the trace header. Could be standard SEGP1, a proprietary version etc.
Column Comment.8: HEADER OFFSET: the offset of the header in number of bytes
Column Comment.9: HEADER WORD: the header word defined for the information particle on the header.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: WORD LENGTH: The length of the header element - can include definition ofdecimal places if needed.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
